meanings.definition: A convex molding in the form of a quarter of a circle
meanings.sent1: The carpenter added an ovolos to the ceiling, giving it a rounded edge.
meanings.sent2: The ancient building featured intricate ovolos along its archways.
meanings.sent3: The ovolos on the wall looked like little smiles, making the room feel welcoming.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed off the ovolos in the hallway, filling the space with joy.
meanings.sent5: The sunlight cast a shadow that emphasized the ovolos, creating a beautiful pattern on the floor.

meanings.definition: A type of ancient Greek coin
meanings.sent1: In the museum, you can see an ovolos from the time of ancient Greece.
meanings.sent2: Collectors often seek out rare ovolos to add to their coin collections.
meanings.sent3: The ovolos in the display case seemed to whisper stories of the past.
meanings.sent4: His eyes sparkled when he held the ovolos, feeling a connection to history.
meanings.sent5: The ovolos gleamed under the museum lights, captivating all who passed by.

meanings.definition: A decorative element in architecture consisting of an egg-and-dart pattern
meanings.sent1: The grand entrance featured intricate ovolos, adding elegance to the building.
meanings.sent2: The ovolos on the pillars were meticulously crafted, showcasing the artisan's skill.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child pointed at the ovolos, pretending they were tiny eggs to collect.
meanings.sent4: As she walked through the hallway, the ovolos seemed to follow her every step.
meanings.sent5: The ovolos stood out against the plain walls, drawing attention to the architectural detail.
